disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Friday 16 March to end of Saturday 17 March GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Friday will start with some cloud and rain, becoming dryer and sunnier later in the day. Fresh air arriving from the Atlantic will bring little in terms of air pollution. <br/><br/>Back trajectories indicate the air arriving on Saturday early morning would have travelled over the continent, potentially we may see low levels of import from Germany early in the day. Air path will change by the end of the day to become more northerly, originating in Finland, bringing less in terms of polluted air. Increasing wind speeds that should aid dispersion of local emissions.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants during the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>
